title: Steering, Suspension, Brake Systems, Wheel Assemblies and Undercarriage

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What causes hard steering in a hydraulic steering system?

options.B: Low fluid level, worn pump, or restriction in system.

explanations.A: High pressure would make steering easier, not harder.
explanations.B: These conditions reduce hydraulic assist requiring more steering effort.
explanations.C: New components should improve steering feel.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What indicates a failing steering pump?

options.B: Whining noise, hard steering, or fluid leaks.

explanations.B: Pump wear creates noise and reduces assist pressure.
explanations.C: Easy steering indicates good pump function.
explanations.D: Temperature doesn't primarily indicate pump failure.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What causes steering wheel free play?

options.B: Worn steering gear, loose linkage, or worn tie rod ends.

explanations.B: Wear in these components creates excessive clearance and free play.
explanations.D: Tight steering doesn't cause free play.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How is steering system pressure tested?

options.B: Install pressure gauge in system and test while turning steering wheel against stop.

explanations.B: Pressure testing identifies pump output and relief valve settings.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What indicates worn tie rod ends?

options.B: Excessive play, clicking noise, or uneven tire wear.

explanations.B: Wear creates play and allows steering misalignment causing tire wear.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What causes steering to drift or pull to one side?

options.B: Misalignment, uneven tire pressure, or brake drag.

explanations.B: These conditions create unequal forces causing directional pull.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How are steering cylinder seals diagnosed?

options.B: Check for external leaks and loss of steering assist.

explanations.A: Age doesn't indicate current seal condition.
explanations.B: Leaking seals show fluid traces and reduce hydraulic pressure.
explanations.D: Wheel color doesn't indicate seal condition.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What indicates a failing steering control valve?

options.B: Erratic steering, loss of assist, or fluid leaks.

explanations.A: Smooth response indicates good valve function.
explanations.B: Valve wear causes inconsistent pressure distribution and leakage.
explanations.C: Perfect operation indicates proper valve function.
explanations.D: Temperature doesn't primarily indicate valve condition.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What causes steering to bind or catch?

options.B: Damaged steering gear, bent linkage, or seized joints.

explanations.B: Mechanical damage prevents smooth movement.
explanations.D: Fluid cleanliness doesn't cause mechanical binding.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How is steering gear backlash measured?

options.B: Measure steering wheel movement before wheels begin to turn.

explanations.B: Measuring free play quantifies steering gear internal clearance.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What indicates contaminated steering fluid?

options.B: Dark color, burnt smell, or metal particles.

explanations.B: Contamination indicates component wear or fluid breakdown.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What causes steering shimmy or vibration?

options.B: Loose steering components, worn bushings, or wheel imbalance.

explanations.B: Looseness or imbalance creates oscillation transmitted to steering.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How are articulated steering systems diagnosed?

options.B: Check cylinder operation, pivot points, and hydraulic pressure.

explanations.B: Comprehensive checks identify wear and hydraulic issues.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What indicates worn suspension bushings?

options.B: Excessive play, cracking, or separation from metal.

explanations.B: Bushing wear allows excessive movement and creates noise.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What causes rough ride quality?

options.B: Worn shocks, broken springs, or excessive tire pressure.

explanations.B: These conditions prevent suspension from absorbing bumps effectively.
explanations.D: Alignment doesn't primarily affect ride harshness.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How are shock absorbers tested?

options.B: Check for leaks, bounce test, and verify dampening action.

explanations.B: These tests evaluate shock dampening effectiveness.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What indicates a broken suspension spring?

options.B: Sagging on one corner, harsh ride, or visible break.

explanations.A: Level height indicates good spring condition.
explanations.B: Broken springs lose support causing sagging and poor ride.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What causes suspension noise during travel?

options.B: Worn bushings, loose components, or dry pivot points.

explanations.B: Wear and lack of lubrication create squeaks and clunks.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How is hydro-pneumatic suspension pressure checked?

options.B: Use pressure gauge on accumulator charging valve.

explanations.B: Gauge reading verifies proper gas pre-charge in accumulators.
explanations.D: Ride height is a symptom but doesn't show actual pressure.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What indicates worn suspension ball joints?

options.B: Excessive vertical or horizontal play, grease leakage.

explanations.B: Ball joint wear creates dangerous play requiring replacement.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What causes uneven vehicle stance?

options.B: Broken spring, weak shock, or uneven load distribution.

explanations.B: Component failure or loading causes one corner to sag.
explanations.C: Level ground allows proper stance evaluation.
explanations.D: New suspension should provide level stance.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How are suspension air springs diagnosed?

options.B: Check for leaks, verify pressure, inspect for cracks or damage.

explanations.B: These checks identify leaks and structural damage.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What indicates suspension travel is limited?

options.B: Bottoming out, harsh impacts, or damaged bump stops.

explanations.B: Insufficient travel causes hard contact with stops and damage.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What causes suspension to sag over time?

options.B: Spring fatigue, worn shocks, or bushing deterioration.

explanations.B: Component wear allows gradual settling and sagging.
explanations.C: Maintenance slows but doesn't prevent eventual wear.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How is suspension alignment verified?

options.B: Use alignment equipment to measure camber, caster, and toe.

explanations.B: Alignment equipment provides accurate angle measurements.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What diagnostic procedure identifies suspension geometry problems?

options.A: Visual inspection and measuring suspension angles and positions.
options.B: Random inspection.

explanations.A: Measurement of angles and positioning identifies bent or damaged components.
explanations.B: Systematic measurement is required.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: For a properly adjusted air brake system, what is the correct angle between the slack adjuster arm and the brake chamber push rod?

options.B: 60° when released.

explanations.B: Measurement is taken when brakes are applied.
explanations.C: 90° provides maximum mechanical advantage when brakes are applied.
explanations.D: Correct angle is measured during application, not release.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What causes spongy brake pedal feel?

options.B: Air in hydraulic system or low fluid level.

explanations.B: Air compresses unlike fluid, creating soft pedal feel.
explanations.C: New pads improve pedal feel after bedding.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What indicates brake fluid contamination?

options.B: Dark color, debris, or water absorption indicated by low boiling point.

explanations.B: Contamination degrades brake performance and causes component damage.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What causes brake pull to one side?

options.B: Seized caliper, contaminated lining, or misadjusted brakes.
options.C: New brake pads on both sides.

explanations.B: Unequal braking force causes directional pull.
explanations.C: New pads both sides provide equal braking.
explanations.D: Fluid level doesn't cause unequal braking.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How is brake rotor runout measured?

options.B: Using dial indicator while rotating rotor.

explanations.B: Dial indicator accurately measures rotor wobble.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What indicates worn brake pads or shoes?

options.B: Low pedal, squealing noise, or material at minimum thickness.

explanations.B: Wear indicators and reduced material signal replacement need.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What causes brake fade?

options.B: Overheating from excessive use reducing friction.

explanations.B: Excessive heat reduces friction material effectiveness.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How are brake calipers inspected?

options.B: Check for leaks, piston movement, slide operation, and pad wear.

explanations.B: Comprehensive inspection identifies wear and malfunction.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What indicates air brake system leakage?

options.B: Pressure drop exceeding limits with brakes applied or released.

explanations.B: Excessive pressure drop indicates leakage requiring repair.
explanations.D: Compressor noise doesn't indicate system leaks.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What causes brake pulsation during application?

options.B: Warped rotors, uneven lining wear, or loose components.

explanations.B: Uneven surfaces create pulsing sensation through brake pedal.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How is brake proportioning valve operation verified?

options.B: Measure pressure at front and rear during braking.

explanations.B: Pressure measurement confirms valve properly distributes braking force.
explanations.D: Fluid color doesn't indicate valve function.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What indicates parking brake adjustment is needed?

options.A: Full application with little lever travel.
options.B: Excessive lever travel or inadequate holding force.

explanations.B: Excessive travel or weak holding indicates adjustment need.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What causes brake noise during application?

options.B: Glazed pads, worn hardware, or contamination.

explanations.A: Quality pads operate quietly after bedding.
explanations.B: These conditions create vibration and noise.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How is master cylinder condition diagnosed?

options.B: Check for external leaks, internal bypass, and pedal feel.

explanations.B: These checks identify seal wear and internal damage.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What causes wheel bearing failure?

options.B: Lack of lubrication, over-tightening, or contamination.

explanations.B: These conditions accelerate bearing wear and cause failure.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How are wheel bearings checked for wear?

options.B: Check for play, roughness, noise, or heat.

explanations.B: These symptoms identify bearing wear requiring service.
explanations.D: Tire pressure doesn't indicate bearing condition.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What indicates improper wheel bearing adjustment?

options.B: Excessive play or no rotation due to over-tightening.

explanations.A: Smooth rotation with minimal play indicates proper adjustment.
explanations.B: Improper adjustment causes either looseness or binding.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What causes uneven tire wear?

options.B: Misalignment, improper inflation, or worn suspension components.

explanations.B: These conditions create abnormal contact patterns causing uneven wear.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How is wheel runout measured?

options.B: Using dial indicator while rotating wheel.

explanations.B: Dial indicator measures radial and lateral runout accurately.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What indicates a bent wheel rim?

options.B: Visible deformation, vibration, or inability to hold air pressure.

explanations.B: Bent rims create multiple problems requiring replacement.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What causes wheel seal leakage?

options.B: Worn seal, damaged hub surface, or over-lubrication.

explanations.B: These conditions allow lubricant to escape from hub.
explanations.C: Proper lubrication doesn't cause external leaks.
explanations.D: Correct adjustment doesn't cause seal leakage.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How are wheel studs and nuts inspected?

options.B: Check for damage, proper torque, and thread condition.

explanations.B: Damaged or loose fasteners create safety hazards.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What indicates tire imbalance?

options.B: Vibration at specific speeds, uneven tread wear.

explanations.B: Imbalance creates speed-related vibration and uneven wear.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What causes hub overheating?

options.B: Over-tightened bearings, lack of lubrication, or brake drag.

explanations.B: Excessive friction generates heat causing damage.
explanations.C: Cold weather typically reduces operating temperature.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How is tire sidewall damage assessed?

options.B: Inspect for cuts, bulges, or cord exposure requiring replacement.

explanations.B: Structural damage compromises tire integrity requiring replacement.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What diagnostic procedure identifies wheel bearing noise?

options.A: Listen for growling that changes with speed, intensifies in turns.
options.B: Random inspection.

explanations.A: Bearing noise has characteristic sound and behavior patterns.
explanations.B: Systematic diagnosis is required.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What is the purpose of the crawler track recoil spring?

options.B: To maintain idler alignment.
options.C: To absorb shock when track encounters obstacle.
options.D: To absorb extra tension under load.

explanations.A: Recoil springs allow temporary tension increase, not maintain constant tension.
explanations.B: Mounting brackets maintain idler alignment.
explanations.C: Recoil springs cushion impact loads protecting undercarriage components.
explanations.D: While they accommodate tension changes, shock absorption is primary function.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How should track roller wear be checked?

options.B: Compare diameter to flange width.

explanations.A: Diameter measurement is more critical than width comparison.
explanations.B: Comparing different dimensions doesn't show actual wear.
explanations.D: Both measurements show wear and determine replacement need.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What indicates excessive track tension?

options.B: Difficulty in adjusting, rapid wear, or power loss.

explanations.A: Excessive tension makes track tight, not loose.
explanations.B: Over-tension increases friction causing wear and power loss.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How are track shoes inspected for wear?

options.B: Measure grouser height, check for cracks, and inspect mounting hardware.

explanations.A: Measurement is required for accurate assessment.
explanations.B: Comprehensive inspection identifies replacement needs.
explanations.C: Track shoes wear from ground contact.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What causes undercarriage to make noise?

options.B: Worn rollers, loose track, or damaged bearings.

explanations.A: New components operate quietly after break-in.
explanations.B: Wear and looseness create characteristic undercarriage noises.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What indicates sprocket wear?

options.B: Rounded or hooked teeth, excessive play with track.

explanations.B: Tooth wear allows poor engagement and track skipping.
explanations.D: Perfect engagement indicates good sprocket condition.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How is track sag measured?

options.B: Measure distance from track to ground or frame at midpoint between rollers.

explanations.B: Measurement determines if tension adjustment is needed.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What causes idler wheel failure?

options.B: Lack of lubrication, misalignment, or impact damage.

explanations.B: These conditions accelerate wear and cause failure.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What indicates track link wear?

options.B: Elongated bushings, worn pins, or excessive pitch length.

explanations.B: Link wear increases track length requiring adjustment or replacement.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How are carrier rollers diagnosed?

options.B: Check for play, roughness, leaking seals, and flange wear.

explanations.B: Comprehensive inspection identifies wear and seal failure.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What causes rapid undercarriage wear?

options.B: Abrasive conditions, improper tension, or lack of lubrication.

explanations.B: These conditions accelerate wear requiring frequent replacement.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What indicates track frame damage?

options.B: Visible bending, cracks, or misalignment of components.

explanations.B: Frame damage affects alignment and creates accelerated wear.

questions.taskTitle: Diagnoses steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How is undercarriage alignment verified?

options.B: Check track wear patterns, measure component positions, verify parallel operation.

explanations.B: Systematic checks identify misalignment causing uneven wear.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How should steering cylinders be replaced?

options.B: Remove old cylinder, install new with proper orientation, bleed air, check operation.

explanations.A: Air must be bled for proper operation.
explanations.B: Complete installation and bleeding ensure proper steering function.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What procedure applies when replacing tie rod ends?

options.B: Replace, torque to specification, and perform alignment.

explanations.A: Alignment is required after tie rod replacement.
explanations.B: Proper installation and alignment ensure safe steering and tire wear.
explanations.C: Proper torque is critical for safety.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How should steering pump be replaced?

options.B: Install pump, fill reservoir, prime system, bleed air, check pressure.

explanations.B: Proper installation and bleeding ensure pump longevity.
explanations.D: Air must be bled from system.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What must be adjusted after steering gear replacement?

options.B: Backlash, preload, and alignment.

explanations.B: These adjustments ensure proper steering feel and response.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How should steering hoses be replaced?

options.B: Use correct pressure-rated hose, route properly, torque fittings, check for leaks.

explanations.B: Proper hose and installation ensure safe, leak-free operation.
explanations.C: Kinks restrict flow and damage hoses.
explanations.D: Loose fittings leak and cause loss of steering assist.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What procedure prevents contamination during steering system service?

options.B: Cap all openings, use clean fluid, work in clean area.

explanations.B: Cleanliness prevents valve and pump damage.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How should steering linkage be lubricated?

options.B: Use appropriate grease at specified intervals and fittings.

explanations.A: Lubrication is essential for linkage life.
explanations.B: Proper lubrication prevents wear and binding.
explanations.C: Grease provides better protection than oil.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What must be verified after steering system repairs?

options.B: Proper operation, no leaks, correct fluid level, and alignment.

explanations.B: Comprehensive checks confirm successful repair.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How should steering column be serviced?

options.B: Replace worn bearings, check for damage, lubricate as specified.

explanations.A: Worn bearings cause binding and noise.
explanations.B: Proper service ensures smooth steering operation.
explanations.D: Functional inspection and service are required.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What safety procedure applies when working on steering systems?

options.B: Relieve pressure, secure wheels, follow proper procedures.

explanations.B: Proper procedures prevent injuries during service.
explanations.D: Safety is critical when working on steering.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How should power steering fluid be changed?

options.B: Drain system, flush if needed, refill with correct fluid, bleed air.

explanations.B: Complete fluid change removes contaminants and ensures performance.
explanations.C: Topping off doesn't remove contaminated fluid.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How should suspension bushings be replaced?

options.B: Press out old bushings, clean bores, press in new bushings with proper tools.

explanations.B: Proper tools ensure correct installation without damage.
explanations.C: Worn bushings cause handling and wear problems.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What procedure applies when replacing shock absorbers?

options.B: Install with new mounting hardware, torque to specification, check operation.

explanations.A: Proper hardware is required for secure mounting.
explanations.B: New hardware and proper torque ensure safe installation.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How should suspension springs be replaced?

options.B: Use proper spring compressor, relieve tension safely, install new spring.

explanations.A: Compressed springs are extremely dangerous without proper tools.
explanations.B: Spring compressors prevent serious injuries during removal and installation.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What must be done after suspension component replacement?

options.B: Perform alignment, torque all fasteners, road test.

explanations.B: Alignment and testing confirm successful repair.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How should ball joints be replaced?

options.B: Use proper removal tools, press or bolt in new joint, torque to specification.

explanations.A: Hammering damages joints and mounting surfaces.
explanations.B: Proper tools and procedures ensure safe, correct installation.
explanations.D: Loose ball joints are extremely dangerous.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What procedure applies to hydro-pneumatic suspension service?

options.B: Relieve pressure, service components, recharge to specification.

explanations.B: Pressure relief and proper recharging ensure safe service.
explanations.C: Pressure must be relieved for safety.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How should suspension fasteners be torqued?

options.B: Torque to manufacturer specifications with suspension loaded.

explanations.A: Proper torque is critical for safety.
explanations.B: Loading suspension during torquing prevents bushing bind.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What lubrication is required for suspension components?

options.B: Grease fittings per schedule, lubricate pivot points as specified.

explanations.B: Proper lubrication prevents wear and binding.
explanations.C: Grease provides better protection for suspension.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How should air suspension be serviced?

options.B: Deflate system, inspect components, replace worn parts, inflate and test.

explanations.B: Deflation allows safe inspection and service.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What must be checked after suspension repair?

options.B: Ride height, alignment, all fastener torque, and operation.

explanations.B: These verifications confirm safe and proper suspension function.
explanations.D: All related components must be verified.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How should stabilizer bars be serviced?

options.B: Replace worn bushings and links, check for damage, lubricate as needed.

explanations.B: Proper service ensures stabilizer reduces body roll.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How should brake pads be replaced?

options.B: Clean caliper, install new pads with proper hardware, lubricate slide pins.

explanations.B: Complete service ensures quiet, effective braking.
explanations.C: Worn hardware causes noise and uneven wear.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What procedure applies when replacing brake rotors?

options.B: Clean hub, install rotor, torque fasteners, bed in new pads.

explanations.B: Proper installation and bedding ensure optimal braking.
explanations.C: Protective coating must be removed before use.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How should brake calipers be rebuilt?

options.B: Disassemble, clean, replace all seals and boots, reassemble with brake fluid.

explanations.A: Old seals leak and cause failure.
explanations.B: Complete rebuild with clean parts ensures proper operation.
explanations.D: Grease contaminates brake fluid and damages seals.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What must be done after brake hydraulic service?

options.B: Bleed all wheels, check fluid level, verify firm pedal before operation.

explanations.A: Bleeding is essential for proper operation.
explanations.B: Complete bleeding removes air ensuring safe braking.
explanations.C: Adding fluid doesn't remove trapped air.
explanations.D: Air must be removed from system.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How should brake drums be serviced?

options.B: Measure for wear, resurface or replace if needed, clean thoroughly.

explanations.B: Proper service ensures effective brake contact and performance.
explanations.D: Drums wear and require periodic service.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What procedure applies to air brake chamber replacement?

options.B: Relieve air pressure, remove old chamber, install new, adjust slack adjuster.

explanations.B: Pressure relief and proper adjustment ensure safe operation.
explanations.C: Pressure must be relieved for safety.
explanations.D: Slack adjuster requires adjustment after chamber replacement.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How should brake slack adjusters be serviced?

options.B: Adjust to achieve proper push rod travel, lubricate splines.

explanations.B: Proper adjustment and lubrication ensure optimal brake operation.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What safety procedure applies when working on brake systems?

options.B: Use proper PPE, relieve pressure, follow procedures, test before operation.

explanations.B: Comprehensive safety ensures technician and vehicle operator safety.
explanations.C: Careful work prevents injuries and ensures quality.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How should brake fluid be changed?

options.B: Drain old fluid, flush system, refill with correct fluid, bleed thoroughly.

explanations.B: Complete fluid change removes moisture and contaminants.
explanations.C: Topping off doesn't remove degraded fluid.
explanations.D: Specific brake fluid type is required.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What must be verified after brake service?

options.B: Firm pedal, proper operation, no leaks, no noise.

explanations.B: Comprehensive testing confirms successful repair.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How should parking brake cables be replaced?

options.B: Route new cable properly, adjust for correct operation, verify release.

explanations.A: Worn cables fail to hold vehicle.
explanations.B: Proper routing and adjustment ensure effective parking brake.
explanations.C: Adjustment is required for proper function.
explanations.D: Correct routing prevents binding and wear.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How should wheel bearings be replaced?

options.B: Press out old bearing, clean hub, press in new bearing, adjust properly.

explanations.B: Proper tools and procedures ensure correct installation.
explanations.D: Proper adjustment is critical for bearing life.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What procedure applies to wheel bearing adjustment?

options.B: Tighten to specification, back off, set to proper preload, secure lock.

explanations.B: Proper procedure ensures bearing longevity and performance.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How should wheel seals be installed?

options.B: Lubricate seal lip, use seal driver, install to proper depth.

explanations.B: Proper installation ensures sealing and prevents premature failure.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What must be done when mounting tires?

options.B: Mount tire, inflate to specification, balance wheel assembly, torque lug nuts.

explanations.A: Unbalanced tires cause vibration and wear.
explanations.B: Complete mounting procedure ensures safe, smooth operation.
explanations.C: Balancing is essential for smooth ride.
explanations.D: Proper torque is critical for wheel safety.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How should lug nuts be torqued?

options.B: In star pattern to specification with torque wrench.

explanations.B: Star pattern and proper torque ensure even wheel mounting.
explanations.C: Impact wrenches can over-torque and damage components.
explanations.D: Hand-tight is insufficient for wheel safety.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What procedure applies when replacing wheel studs?

options.B: Press out old stud, press in new stud, verify proper seating.

explanations.A: Damaged studs can fail causing wheel loss.
explanations.B: Proper installation ensures safe wheel attachment.
explanations.C: Hammering may not fully seat stud.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How should wheels be inspected before installation?

options.B: Check for cracks, damage, proper mounting surface, correct specifications.

explanations.B: Thorough inspection prevents wheel failure.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What lubrication is required for wheel bearings?

options.B: Use proper wheel bearing grease to specified fill level.

explanations.B: Proper grease type and amount ensure bearing longevity.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How should tire pressure be set?

options.B: Inflate to manufacturer specification for load and application.

explanations.A: Incorrect pressure causes wear and handling problems.
explanations.B: Proper pressure ensures safety, wear, and performance.
explanations.C: Maximum pressure may be too high for application.
explanations.D: Minimum pressure is insufficient for most applications.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What must be verified after wheel assembly service?

options.B: Proper torque, no vibration, correct pressure, no leaks.

explanations.B: Comprehensive checks confirm successful service.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How should track tension be adjusted?

options.B: Measure sag, adjust tensioner to specification, verify proper operation.

explanations.B: Proper tension ensures performance and component life.
explanations.D: Loose track causes derailment and damage.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What procedure applies when replacing track shoes?

options.B: Install shoes, torque bolts to specification, verify proper seating.

explanations.B: Proper installation prevents shoe loss and damage.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How should track rollers be replaced?

options.B: Remove old roller, clean mounting, install new roller with proper hardware.

explanations.A: Worn rollers cause excessive wear to other components.
explanations.B: Proper installation ensures roller longevity and track operation.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What lubrication is required for undercarriage?

options.B: Grease all fittings per schedule, check oil levels in sealed components.

explanations.A: Lubrication is critical for undercarriage life.
explanations.B: Proper lubrication prevents premature wear and extends component life.
explanations.C: Grease provides better protection than oil.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How should sprockets be replaced?

options.B: Remove old sprocket, install new, verify alignment, torque fasteners.

explanations.B: Proper installation and alignment ensure even track wear.
explanations.C: Misalignment causes rapid track and sprocket wear.
explanations.D: Proper torque prevents loosening under load.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What procedure applies when replacing idler wheels?

options.B: Replace bearings and seals, lubricate properly, install with correct hardware.

explanations.A: Lubrication is essential for bearing life.
explanations.B: Complete service ensures idler reliability.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How should track links be serviced?

options.B: Measure wear, replace if beyond specification, ensure proper installation.

explanations.A: Worn links stretch track requiring constant adjustment.
explanations.B: Replacing worn links maintains proper track length and tension.
explanations.D: Links wear from pin rotation and load.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What must be done after undercarriage component replacement?

options.B: Adjust tension, check alignment, verify operation, lubricate.

explanations.B: Comprehensive checks ensure proper undercarriage operation.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How should carrier rollers be replaced?

options.B: Replace bearings and seals, install with proper mounting, verify rotation.

explanations.B: Complete service ensures reliable roller operation.
explanations.D: Lubrication is essential for bearing protection.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What safety procedure applies when working on undercarriage?

options.B: Support machine properly, relieve track tension, use proper tools.

explanations.A: Unsupported machines can shift causing serious injury.
explanations.B: Proper support and procedures prevent crushing injuries.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: How should track frame be repaired?

options.B: Assess damage, weld or replace as appropriate, verify alignment.

explanations.A: Damaged frames cause accelerated component wear.
explanations.B: Proper repair restores structural integrity and alignment.
explanations.D: Frame damage significantly affects undercarriage operation.

questions.taskTitle: Repairs steering, suspension, brake systems, wheel assemblies and undercarriage
questions.question: What break-in procedure applies to new undercarriage components?

options.B: Light duty initially, check tension frequently, verify lubrication.

explanations.A: Immediate full load risks damaging new components.
explanations.B: Gradual break-in allows components to seat properly.
